body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**

Today all users of the Go SDK set `client-name` gRPC header as `temporal-go` and set `client-version` gRPC header as the SDK version. The internal uses of the SDK should set it to something besides `temporal-go` to not conflate it with actual `temporal-go` clients. Can use something like `temporal-server` or similar.

We intentionally do not expose a way to change this today, so you either need to set metadata after this is applied (i.e. client interceptor) or set another field like `client-name-override` or similar that will tell you, when consuming, to use it instead of the default one from the SDK.
title: Stop reporting internal SDK client use as the Go SDK
